item.title: Need to research these online IDEs
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: Suddenly got requirement to do IDE (edit, compile, debug, etc) online, i.e. without native software installed, then came across this site, haven’t read through, though. I think one of the most important feature to me is it has to work with Pad, that will make one’s life really interesting.
item.content:encoded:
Suddenly got requirement to do IDE (edit, compile, debug, etc) online, i.e. without native software installed, then came across this site, haven’t read through, though.

I think one of the most important feature to me is it has to work with Pad, that will make one’s life really interesting.

item.title: iPad
item.dc:creator: Hang
item.description: Everytime I looked at an iPad I feel like I want one, but once my hands are on it, I feel … well, no feeling. Cannot recall if I evern mentioned this before – it’s heavy and bulky. I still prefer the size of Kindle Fire, though I’ve moved to Kindle as it’s far lighter. [...]
item.content:encoded:
Everytime I looked at an iPad I feel like I want one, but once my hands are on it, I feel … well, no feeling.

Cannot recall if I evern mentioned this before – it’s heavy and bulky. I still prefer the size of Kindle Fire, though I’ve moved to Kindle as it’s far lighter. Right now what I bring for all the day are only two gadgets – my phone (the 4.3″ HTC Android one, cannot recall exact model, could be G10), and the Kindle.

The Android phone gives me all kind of mobile applications (why people need a Pad for that? Isn’t it too big?) and Kindle give me the best reading experience, especially good to my poor eyes. The only down side is that I always need strong lights whenever I’m reading, but for 99.9% of my time it is not a problem.
